definition: "Summary of the Collection of Rhymes Old and New", supplemented and annotated Yuan dynasty version of the no-longer-extant late Song or early Yuan "Collection of Rhymes Old and New" 古今韻會|古今韵会
pinyin: Gu3 jin1 Yun4 hui4 Ju3 yao4

definition: the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])
to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if

Longkan Shoujian, Chinese character dictionary from 997 AD containing 26,430 entries, with radicals placed into 240 rhyme groups and arranged according to the four tones, and the rest of the characters similarly arranged under each radical
to proofread/to revise one or more editions of a text using an authoritative edition as a source book/to editorially revise a text
Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
Qieyun, the first Chinese rime dictionary from 601 AD, containing 11,500 single-character entries
see 龍龕手鑑|龙龛手鉴[Long2 kan1 Shou3 jian4]
rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
